thread.title: Café swamped with customers after given a Michelin star by mistake | Metro News
thread.title_full: Café swamped with customers after given a Michelin star by mistake | Metro News

author: Simon Robb For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Café swamped with customers after given a Michelin star by mistake | Metro News
text:
Simon Robb for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 9:32 am Le Bouche a Oreille became overrun with a very different clientele (Picture: Google Maps) 
A workmen’s café was swamped with fine dining lovers after it was awarded a Michelin star by mistake. 
Le Bouche à Oreille is a cheap and cheerful eatery in France where people can dig into a homemade beef bourguignon over red-and-white polka dot tablecloths. Heartbreaking moment young widow meets her military husband’s coffin on airport tarmac 
Staff are used to serving local tradesman looking for a quick meal, but the venue became overrun by epicures and TV crews after news emerged that the café won the world renowned accolade. 
‘We’re swamped. I don’t have much space and there are only four waiters,’ owner Véronique Jacquet told Le Parisien . 
But the star was never meant for the small café in Bourges. The guide was printed Thursday last week (Picture: Frederic Stevens/Getty Images) 
There’s another Bouche à Oreille, in Boutervilliers near Paris, which adorn their tables with linen and serve up more extravagant fare like calf’s brain and lobster flan. Woman holds her broken heart after life-saving transplant 
Guide Michelin France, which published its 2017 version last week, mixed up the two diners and it took nearly a week to correct the error. 
‘We apologised to the two establishments and we are sorry to have misled our clients,’ the guide’s Claire Dorland-Clauzel told the French newspaper. More
